New Records: Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer, marking the first regular-season win for the St. Louis Cardinals at Yankee Stadium since 1964.
Ryan Helsley became the first Cardinal to record a save in the Bronx since Ron Taylor in the 1964 World Series.
Key Match Events: Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer in the third inning.
Kyle Gibson pitched seven strong innings, allowing one run and five hits.
Iván Herrera hit an RBI double in the sixth inning and scored on a throwing error.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run double in the eighth inning.
Ryan Helsley secured the save in the ninth inning by striking out Austin Wells.
Post-Match Reflections: Brendan Donovan expressed pride in hitting a home run and contributing to the team's first win at Yankee Stadium in 60 years.
Kyle Gibson reflected on his performance, focusing on clearing his mind and not dwelling on past outings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals improved their record to 1-7 at Yankee Stadium in the regular season.
The game featured a pitch-clock violation resulting in a strikeout for Oswaldo Cabrera.
Others: Cardinals' LHP Steven Matz is expected to be added to the roster when it expands to 28 players.
Yankees' 1B Anthony Rizzo is likely to be activated off the injured list after missing over two months.
